IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE THE HIGHEST QUALITY LIBERAL AND PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION AND TO INTEGRATE THE TWO BY CREATING A STIMULATING INTELLECTUAL COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: BUTLER UNIVERSITY, FOUNDED ON IDEALS OF EQUITY AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, CREATES AND FOSTERS A COLLABORATIVE, STIMULATING INTELLECTUAL LEARNING ENVIRONMENT. WE ARE INSPIRED TO BOLDLY INNOVATE AND BROADLY EDUCATE, ENRICHING COMMUNITIES AND PREPARING ALL LEARNERS TO LEAD MEANINGFUL LIVES.
IRS990.Desc: EDUCATION: BUTLER UNIVERSITY DELIVERS AN OUTSTANDING EDUCATION STEEPED IN THE LIBERAL ARTS AND COUPLED WITH EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES THAT INCLUDE INTERNSHIPS, STUDY ABROAD, SERVICE PROJECTS, AND SCHOLARLY RESEARCH. THROUGH THIS COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH, WE PREPARE STUDENTS TO STEP DIRECTLY INTO A CAREER OR GRADUATE SCHOOL WITH CONFIDENCE. THE UNIVERSITY'S MOST RECENT PLACEMENT RATE WAS 98 PERCENT, INCLUDING 26 PERCENT THAT WENT ON TO ATTEND GRADUATE SCHOOL OR PARTICIPATE IN A GAP-YEAR PROGRAM. IN ITS RANKINGS FOR 2025, U.S. NEWS AND WORLD REPORT NAMED BUTLER THE NO. 1 SCHOOL AMONG MIDWEST REGIONAL UNIVERSITIES FOR THE SEVENTH CONSECUTIVE YEAR AND THE MOST INNOVATIVE SCHOOL IN THE MIDWEST FOR THE TENTH CONSECUTIVE YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO WAS LISTED AMONG THE BEST FOR FIRST-YEAR EXPERIENCES AND STUDY ABROAD. AUXILIARY: BUTLER ARTS AND EVENTS CENTER (BAEC): BUTLER ARTS AND EVENTS CENTER IS A HOME FOR PASSION, CREATIVITY, EDUCATION, AND THE HIGHEST CALIBER OF PROFESSIONAL AND STUDENT PERFORMANCES. WITH OVER 300 STUDENT, FACULTY, AND PROFESSIONAL PERFORMANCES EACH YEAR, BAEC INCLUDES CLOWES MEMORIAL HALL, SCHROTT CENTER FOR THE ARTS, SHELTON AUDITORIUM, THE KRANNERT ROOM, EIDSON-DUCKWALL RECITAL HALL, AND LILLY HALL STUDIO THEATRE AND IS A DESTINATION FOR EXCEPTIONAL ARTS AND ENTERTAINMENT EXPERIENCES AND AN INCUBATOR FOR OUTSTANDING ARTS PROFESSIONALS. HEALTH AND RECREATION COMPLEX: A HEALTH AND RECREATION COMPLEX THAT IS EQUIPPED WITH RECREATION COURTS, AN INDOOR JOGGING TRACK, AN AQUATICS AREA, A WEIGHT AND FITNESS SPACE, AND LOUNGE OPENED IN FALL 2006. STUDENTS ENROLLED IN AT LEAST 12 CREDIT HOURS ARE AUTOMATIC MEMBERS. MEMBERSHIP IS ALSO AVAILABLE TO UNIVERSITY FACULTY, STAFF, ALUMNI, AND A LIMITED NUMBER OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS. ATHLETICS: BUTLER UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS AT THE NCAA DIVISION I LEVEL. NINETEEN OF BUTLER'S 20 TEAMS COMPETE IN THE BIG EAST, WHILE THE FOOTBALL PROGRAM IS A MEMBER OF THE PIONEER FOOTBALL LEAGUE. THE BULLDOGS HAVE A LONG HISTORY OF ATHLETIC SUCCESS, INCLUDING BACK-TO-BACK TRIPS TO THE NCAA DIVISION I MEN'S BASKETBALL NATIONAL CHAMPIONSHIP GAME IN 2010 AND 2011, AND THE UNIVERSITY IS HOME TO ONE OF THE NATION'S GREAT INTERCOLLEGIATE BASKETBALL FACILITIES, HINKLE FIELDHOUSE. FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT BUTLER ATHLETICS, VISIT WWW.BUTLERSPORTS.COM. ROOM AND BOARD: BUTLER STUDENTS CAN CHOOSE FROM A NUMBER OF HOUSING OPTIONS, INCLUDING A RESIDENTIAL APARTMENT VILLAGE FOR JUNIORS AND SENIORS, AN APARTMENT-STYLE RESIDENCE HALL, TWO COEDUCATIONAL RESIDENCE HALLS, AND 13 FRATERNITIES AND SORORITIES. A 660-BED MODERN, SUITE-STYLE HOUSING FACILITY - PREDOMINATELY FOR SOPHOMORES - OPENED IN FALL 2016, AND A 647-BED, SUITE-STYLE RESIDENCE HALL FOR FIRST-YEAR STUDENTS OPENED IN FALL 2018. ALL BUTLER UNDERGRADUATES ARE REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS FOR SIX ACADEMIC YEAR SEMESTERS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Pepper Construction Company of IND LLC

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part I Special Rule Reporting:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION CHECKED IN SCHEDULE A, PART I, THAT IT IS ORGANIZED AS SCHOOL, CATEGORY 2, PER ITS EXEMPTION LETTER. THE ORGANIZATION HAS COMPLETED SCHEDULE A, PART II TO PROVE THAT IT MEETS THE DEFINITION OF A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION UNDER CATEGORY 7 AND CAN USE A SPECIAL REPORTING RULE ON SCHEDULE B.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule C, Part II-B, Line 1 DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE LOBBYING ACTIVITY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY PAID A CONSULTANT, MARKET STREET GROUP INC., TO LOBBY ON THEIR BEHALF AGAINST LEGISLATION THAT IF PASSED WOULD GIVE HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS IN INDIANA THE RESPONSIBILITY OF LICENSING TEACHERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part II, Line 9 Conservation easements financial reporting
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S CONSERVATION EASEMENT WAS GRANTED AS A CONDITION OF ELIGIBILITY FOR THE SAVE AMERICA'S TREASURES GRANT PROGRAM. THE UNIVERSITY RECORDED GRANT REVENUE AND USED IT TO SUPPORT THE RENOVATION OF THE EXTERIOR OF HINKLE FIELDHOUSE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part III, Line 4 Collections of art - description of collections
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS ART, MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS, AND A RARE BOOK COLLECTION FOR EDUCATION, SCHOLARLY RESEARCH AND PRESERVATION FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part V, Line 4 Intended uses of endowment funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE GOVERNING BODY TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS (BOARD-DESIGNATED ENDOWMENT FUNDS). THE ENDOWMENT IS AVAILABLE FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, ACADEMIC PROGRAMS, AND OTHER INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part X, Line 2 FIN 48 (ASC 740) footnote
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THEIR INCOME TAX POSITIONS UNDER THE GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN ASC 740. BASED ON THEIR REVIEW, MANAGEMENT HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY MATERIAL UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECORDED OR DISCLOSED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 3 RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO MAINTAINING A RESPECTFUL EDUCATIONAL ENVIRONMENT, FREE FROM DISCRIMINATION AND HARRASSMENT. BUTLER DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AGE, DISABILITY, CITIZENSHIP STATUS, MILITARY STATUS, SEX, GENDER, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY, GENDER EXPRESSION, OR GENETIC INFORMATION. NO STUDENT OR APPLICANT FOR ADMISSION WILL BE EXCLUDED FROM PARTICIPATION IN, DENIED BENEFITS OF, OR SUBJECTED TO DISCRIMINATION IN ANY EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM, OPPORTUNITY, OR ACTIVITY. THIS IS PUBLICLY AVAILABLE ON BUTLER UNIVERSITY'S WEBSITE AT WWW.BUTLER.EDU/BIAS/COMMUNITY-STANDARDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Part I, Line 6(a) FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENT
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY RECEIVES CERTAIN AMOUNTS FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES FOR SUPPORT OF ITS RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY HAS STUDENTS WHO STUDY ABROAD. THE FINANCIAL AID RECEIVED BY STUDENTS WHO STUDY ABROAD IS A REDUCTION OR WAIVER OF BUTLER UNIVERSITY TUITION WHILE THE STUDENT IS STUDYING ABROAD. BUTLER UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN QUALIFICATION CRITERIA FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AND FOLLOWS A WRITTEN APPROVAL PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part I, Line 3 Method used to account for expenditures on org's financial statements
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN-Accrual; EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC-Accrual; EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND AND GREENLAND)-Accrual; SOUTH AMERICA-Accrual; SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA-Accrual

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule F, Part III Method used to account for expenditures on org's financial statements
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EAST ASIA AND THE PACIFIC -Accrual EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND AND GREENLAND) -Accrual SOUTH AMERICA -Accrual

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY HAS WRITTEN QUALIFICATION CRITERIA FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AND FOLLOWS A WRITTEN APPROVAL PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a First-class or charter travel
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHARTER TRAVEL IS OCCASIONALLY USED FOR CERTAIN ATHLETIC TEAM TRAVEL WHEN IT CREATES AN OPPORTUNITY TO REDUCE MISSED CLASS TIME FOR STUDENT ATHLETES. CHARTER TRAVEL IS ALSO USED BY ATHLETIC DEPARTMENT PERSONNEL ON A LIMITED BASIS FOR ATHLETIC RECRUITING PURPOSES AND BY JAMES DANKO, THE UNIVERSITY'S PRESIDENT, WHEN COMMERCIAL TRAVEL IS NOT EFFICIENT. THE VALUE OF PERSONAL TRAVEL IS INCLUDED IN MR. DANKO'S TAXABLE INCOME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Travel for companions
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SPOUSAL TRAVEL IS PROVIDED TO THE ATHLETIC DIRECTOR, BARRY COLLIER, ON OCCASION. THE VALUE OF THIS SPOUSAL TRAVEL IS INCLUDED IN HIS TAXABLE INCOME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Housing allowance or residence for personal use
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY PROVIDES A RESIDENCE AND HOUSEHOLD SERVICES FOR JAMES DANKO, THE UNIVERSITY'S PRESIDENT. THE RESIDENCE AND HOUSEHOLD SERVICES ARE NOT INCLUDED IN MR. DANKO'S TAXABLE INCOME. THE RESIDENCE IS FURNISHED FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF BUTLER UNIVERSITY, AND IT IS AVAILABLE FOR USE TO HOST FACULTY, STAFF, AND STUDENT FUNCTIONS. JAMES DANKO WAS REQUIRED TO LIVE IN THE RESIDENCE AS A CONDITION OF HIS EMPLOYMENT, AND HIS RESIDENCE IS CONTIGUOUS TO BUTLER'S CAMPUS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 1a Health or social club dues or initiation fees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY PAYS SOCIAL CLUB DUES FOR JAMES DANKO, BARRY COLLIER, THAD MATTA, AND AUSTIN PARKINSON. THE PERSONAL USE OF THESE DUES IS INCLUDED IN EACH EMPLOYEE'S TAXABLE INCOME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 7 Non-fixed payments
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BONUSES INCLUDED IN PART II, COLUMN (II) ARE PERFORMANCE-BASED BONUSES FOR 2022-23. THESE BONUSES WERE APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule K, Part IV, Line 2c COLUMN B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Issuer name: INDIANA FINANCE AUTHORITY The calculation for computing no rebate due was performed on 08/04/2023

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I Number of Contributors:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Butler University reports the number of contributors in column (B).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule M, Part I, Line 9 SECURITIES - PUBLICLY TRADED:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS ON SCHEDULE M ARE REPORTED IN THE YEAR RECEIVED. PUBLICLY TRADED SECURITIES IN THE AMOUNT OF $200,747 RECEIVED WERE PLEDGE PAYMENTS THAT WERE RECORDED AS REVENUE ON PART VIII OF THE FORM 990 IN A PREVIOUS YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b Review of form 990 by governing body
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS FORMALLY DELEGATED AUTHORITY FOR THE REVIEW OF ITS FORM 990 TO THE BUTLER UNIVERSITY STEWARDSHIP COMMITTEE. IN ADDITION, BUTLER'S OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM REVIEWED THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING. BUTLER UTILIZED THIS PROCESS TO ENSURE THAT ITS FORM 990 RECEIVED SUBSTANTIVE REVIEW BY DIRECTORS AND PROFESSIONALS WITH SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE OF BUTLER'S ACTIVITIES AND EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL, ACCOUNTING AND TAX EXPERTISE. BUTLER PROVIDED A COMPLETE COPY OF THE RETURN TO THE ENTIRE BOARD PRIOR TO FILING THE TAX RETURN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c Conflict of interest policy
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY HAS ADOPTED A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THAT REQUIRES DIRECTORS, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO SUBMIT AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE. THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE REQUIRES DIRECTORS, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES TO DISCLOSE, IN WRITING, ANY KNOWN FINANCIAL INTEREST THAT THE INDIVIDUAL (TOGETHER WITH FAMILY MEMBERS) HAS IN ANY BUSINESS ENTITY THAT TRANSACTS BUSINESS WITH BUTLER UNIVERSITY. IN ADDITION, DIRECTORS, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO IMMEDIATELY DISCLOSE ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST THAT ARISES MID-YEAR IN RELATION TO A PROPOSED TRANSACTION. THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY REQUIRES THAT ANY INDIVIDUAL WITH A CONFLICT BE RECUSED FROM THE DECISION-MAKING PROCESS, THAT INDEPENDENT DIRECTORS OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS DETERMINE THAT THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION IS IN THE BEST INTERESTS OF BUTLER UNIVERSITY, AND THE TRANSACTION MUST BE APPROVED BY A VOTE OF THE INDEPENDENT DIRECTORS OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS WITHOUT THE PARTICIPATION OF ANY INTERESTED INDIVIDUAL. THE ANNUAL CONFLICT DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS ARE SUBMITTED TO AND REVIEWED BY THE STEWARDSHIP COMMITTEE, COMPOSED OF INDEPENDENT OUTSIDE DIRECTORS. IN ADDITION, THE EXECUTIVE STAFF IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING ANY POSSIBLE CONFLICT TRANSACTIONS THAT ARISE AND MANAGING THEM TO ENSURE THAT ALL TRANSACTIONS REPRESENT ARMS' LENGTH, FAIR MARKET VALUE TERMS FOR THE BENEFIT OF BUTLER UNIVERSITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a Process to establish compensation of top management official
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BUTLER UNIVERSITY HAS ADOPTED AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION AND INTERMEDIATE SANCTIONS POLICY THAT ENSURES THAT ALL COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS WITH RELATED PARTIES ARE EVALUATED AND ENTERED AT ARMS' LENGTH AND THAT ANY COMPENSATION THAT IS PAID TO A RELATED PARTY IS REASONABLE AND REFLECTS FAIR MARKET VALUE. THE POLICY ENCOURAGES THE APPLICATION OF THE REBUTTABLE PRESUMPTION STANDARD OF CODE SECTION 4958 AND THE RELATED TREASURY REGULATIONS BY (A) EXCLUDING ANY INTERESTED PARTY FROM THE DECISION MAKING PROCESS; (B) REQUIRING DISINTERESTED BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS TO OBTAIN AND RELY UPON COMPARABILITY DATA WHEN SETTING THE PROPOSED COMPENSATION TERMS; (C) REQUIRING APPROVAL OF THE TRANSACTION IN ADVANCE BY DISINTERESTED DIRECTORS OR COMMITTEE MEMBERS; AND (D) REQUIRING CONTEMPORANEOUS DOCUMENTATION (I.E., MINUTES) REFLECTING THE DECISION AND THE PROCESS BY WHICH IT WAS MADE. BUTLER UNIVERSITY HAS DELEGATED AUTHORITY REGARDING EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION MATTERS TO THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, COMPOSED OF INDEPENDENT OUTSIDE DIRECTORS. THE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR APPLYING THE TERMS AND PROCESS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION AND INTERMEDIATE SANCTIONS POLICY AS OUTLINED ABOVE. THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWED THE COMPENSATION IN 2024. COMPENSATION REVIEW OF OTHER OFFICERS WAS CONDUCTED AS PART OF THE ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b Process to establish compensation of other employees
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SAME AS FORM 990, PART VI, LINE 15A ABOVE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19 Required documents available to the public
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE UNIVERSITY MAKES THE FORM 990, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE UNIVERSITY'S BUSINESS OFFICE. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG.
